content:
ApplicationPartition Class

In this Article

The ApplicationPartition class represents an application partition for a particular domain.

Syntax

Declaration

public class ApplicationPartition : System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectoryPartition

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectoryPartition
  • ApplicationPartition

Inherited Members

Dispose()
,
Name
,
ToString()
,
Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Constructors summary

ApplicationPartition(DirectoryContext,String)

Initializes a new instance of the ApplicationPartition class, using the specified distinguished name.
ApplicationPartition(DirectoryContext,String,String)

Initializes a new instance of the ApplicationPartition class, using the specified distinguished name and object class.

Properties summary

DirectoryServers

Gets an DirectoryServerCollection object that contains the directory servers that host this application partition.
SecurityReferenceDomain

Gets and sets the security reference domain for this application partition.

Methods summary

Delete()

Deletes this application partition.
Dispose(Boolean)

Releases the managed resources that are used by the ApplicationPartition object and optionally releases unmanaged resources.
FindAllDirectoryServers()

Returns a ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection object that contains all of the directory servers that host this application partition.
FindAllDirectoryServers(String)

Returns an ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection object that contains all of the directory servers that host this application partition in the specified site.
FindAllDiscoverableDirectoryServers()

Returns a ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection object that contains all of the directory servers that have registered either a site-specific DNS record for the current site or a non-site-specific DNS record for the application partition.
FindAllDiscoverableDirectoryServers(String)

Returns a ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection object that contains all of the directory servers that have registered a site-specific DNS record, for the specified site, for the application partition.
FindByName(DirectoryContext,String)

Returns an ApplicationPartition object for a given DirectoryContext object and distinguished name.
FindDirectoryServer()

Returns a DirectoryServer object for this application partition and current site.
FindDirectoryServer(Boolean)

Returns a DirectoryServer object for the application partition and current site with an option to ignore cached information.
FindDirectoryServer(String)

Returns a DirectoryServer object for the application partition and a specified site.
FindDirectoryServer(String,Boolean)

Returns a DirectoryServer object for this application partition for a specified site, with an option to ignore cached information.
GetApplicationPartition(DirectoryContext)

Returns an ApplicationPartition object for a specified directory context.
GetDirectoryEntry()

Gets a DirectoryEntry object for this application partition.
Save()

Commits all changes to the current application partition object to the underlying directory store.

Constructors

  • ApplicationPartition(DirectoryContext,String)

    Initializes a new instance of the ApplicationPartition class, using the specified distinguished name.

    public ApplicationPartition (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string distinguishedName);

    Parameters

    • context
      DirectoryContext

      The DirectoryContext object that is used to create this application partition.

    • distinguishedName
      String

      The String that specifies the distinguished name for this application partition.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • ArgumentException

      The target in the context parameter is not a server, or the distinguishedName parameter is not in a valid distinguished name format.

    • ArgumentNullException

      context or distinguishedName is null.

    Remarks

    The default object class that represents the application partition is domainDNS.

  • ApplicationPartition(DirectoryContext,String,String)

    Initializes a new instance of the ApplicationPartition class, using the specified distinguished name and object class.

    public ApplicationPartition (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string distinguishedName, string objectClass);

    Parameters

    • context
      DirectoryContext

      The DirectoryContext object that is used to create this application partition.

    • distinguishedName
      String

      The String that specifies the distinguished name for this application partition.

    • objectClass
      String

      The String that specifies the object class that represents this application partition.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • ArgumentException

      The target in the context parameter is not a server, or the distinguishedName parameter is not in a valid distinguished name format. This exception is also thrown if the application partition is being created within an Active Directory forest, rather than an AD LDS configuration set, because the objectClass can only be specified for AD LDS configuration sets.

    • ArgumentNullException

      context or distinguishedName is null.

    Remarks

    The default object class that represents the application partition is domainDNS.

Properties

  • DirectoryServers

    Gets an DirectoryServerCollection object that contains the directory servers that host this application partition.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServerCollection DirectoryServers { get; }

    Property Value

    • DirectoryServerCollection

      A DirectoryServerCollection object that contains DirectoryServer objects that represent directory servers for this application partition.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ApplicationPartition object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

    Remarks

    The DirectoryServers property returns the same collection of DirectoryServer objects as the System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition.FindAllDirectoryServers() method if the ApplicationPartition object has been committed to the underlying directory services store.

  • SecurityReferenceDomain

    Gets and sets the security reference domain for this application partition.

    public string SecurityReferenceDomain { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The distinguished name of the security reference domain for this application.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ApplicationPartition object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store (applies to set only).

    • NotSupportedException

      The application partition is an AD LDS application partition.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

Methods

  • Delete()

    Deletes this application partition.

    public void Delete ();

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ApplicationPartition object has not yet been saved in the underlying directory store.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • Dispose(Boolean)

    Releases the managed resources that are used by the ApplicationPartition object and optionally releases unmanaged resources.

    protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);

    Parameters

    • disposing
      Boolean

      A Boolean value that determines if the managed resources should be released. true if the managed resources should be released; false if only the unmanaged resources should be released.

  • FindAllDirectoryServers()

    Returns a ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection object that contains all of the directory servers that host this application partition.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection FindAllDirectoryServers ();

    Returns

    • ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection

      A ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection object that contains all of the directory servers that host this application partition.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ApplicationPartition object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • FindAllDirectoryServers(String)

    Returns an ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection object that contains all of the directory servers that host this application partition in the specified site.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection FindAllDirectoryServers (string siteName);

    Parameters

    • siteName
      String

      A String that specifies the name of the site to search.

    Returns

    • ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection

      An ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection object that contains the directory servers that host this application partition in the specified site.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      siteName is null.

    • ArgumentException

      siteName is an empty string.

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ApplicationPartition object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • FindAllDiscoverableDirectoryServers()

    Returns a ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection object that contains all of the directory servers that have registered either a site-specific DNS record for the current site or a non-site-specific DNS record for the application partition.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection FindAllDiscoverableDirectoryServers ();

    Returns

    • ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection

      A ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection object that contains the directory servers that were found.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ApplicationPartition object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.

    • NotSupportedException

      The application partition is an AD LDS application partition.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • FindAllDiscoverableDirectoryServers(String)

    Returns a ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection object that contains all of the directory servers that have registered a site-specific DNS record, for the specified site, for the application partition.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection FindAllDiscoverableDirectoryServers (string siteName);

    Parameters

    • siteName
      String

      A String that specifies the name of the site to search.

    Returns

    • ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection

      A ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection object that contains the directory servers that are found.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      siteName is an empty string.

    • ArgumentNullException

      siteName is null.

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ApplicationPartition object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.

    • NotSupportedException

      The application partition is an AD LDS application partition.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • FindByName(DirectoryContext,String)

    Returns an ApplicationPartition object for a given DirectoryContext object and distinguished name.

    public static System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition FindByName (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string distinguishedName);

    Parameters

    • context
      DirectoryContext

      A DirectoryContext object that contains the target and credentials to use for the search.

    • distinguishedName
      String

      A String that contains the distinguished name of the application partition to search for.

    Returns

    • ApplicationPartition

      An ApplicationPartition object that represents the results of the search.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException

      This exception will occur for any one of the following reasons:

      • A target specified in the context parameter could not be found.

      • The target is a configuration set and no AD LDS instance was found in that configuration set.

      • The target is a forest and the application partition was not found in that forest.

      • The target does not host the current application partition.

      • No AD LDS instance was found for the application partition.

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ArgumentNullException

      context or distinguishedName is null.

    • ArgumentException

      This exception will occur for any of the following reasons:

      • The context parameter is not a valid forest, configuration set, or directory server.

      • The distinguishedName has a zero length

      • The distinguishedName parameter is in an invalid format.

  • FindDirectoryServer()

    Returns a DirectoryServer object for this application partition and current site.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer FindDirectoryServer ();

    Returns

    • DirectoryServer

      A DirectoryServer object for this application partition and site.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ApplicationPartition object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • FindDirectoryServer(Boolean)

    Returns a DirectoryServer object for the application partition and current site with an option to ignore cached information.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer FindDirectoryServer (bool forceRediscovery);

    Parameters

    • forceRediscovery
      Boolean

      A Boolean value that indicates whether cached information should be ignored. true if cached information should be ignored; otherwise, false.

    Returns

    • DirectoryServer

      A DirectoryServer object for this application partition and site.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ApplicationPartition object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • FindDirectoryServer(String)

    Returns a DirectoryServer object for the application partition and a specified site.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer FindDirectoryServer (string siteName);

    Parameters

    • siteName
      String

      A String that specifies a site name.

    Returns

    • DirectoryServer

      A DirectoryServer object for this application partition and specified site.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      siteName is an empty string.

    • ArgumentNullException

      siteName is null.

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ApplicationPartition object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • FindDirectoryServer(String,Boolean)

    Returns a DirectoryServer object for this application partition for a specified site, with an option to ignore cached information.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer FindDirectoryServer (string siteName, bool forceRediscovery);

    Parameters

    • siteName
      String

      A String that specifies a site name.

    • forceRediscovery
      Boolean

      A Boolean value that indicates whether cached information should be ignored. true if cached information should be ignored; otherwise, false.

    Returns

    • DirectoryServer

      A DirectoryServer object for this application partition and specified site.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      siteName is an empty string.

    • ArgumentNullException

      siteName is null.

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ApplicationPartition object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • GetApplicationPartition(DirectoryContext)

    Returns an ApplicationPartition object for a specified directory context.

    public static System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition GetApplicationPartition (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context);

    Parameters

    • context
      DirectoryContext

      An DirectoryContext object that contains the target and credentials to use to retrieve the application partition object. The directory context must specify the DNS name of the application partition.

    Returns

    • ApplicationPartition

      An ApplicationPartition object that represents the application partition for the specified directory context.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException

      A target specified in context could not be found.

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ArgumentNullException

      context is null.

    • ArgumentException

      context is not valid.

  • GetDirectoryEntry()

    Gets a DirectoryEntry object for this application partition.

    public override System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry GetDirectoryEntry ();

    Returns

    • DirectoryEntry

      The DirectoryEntry for this application partition.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ApplicationPartition object has not yet been saved in the Active Directory Domain Services store.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • Save()

    Commits all changes to the current application partition object to the underlying directory store.

    public void Save ();

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryObjectExistsException

      An application partition with the same name already exists.

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.
